perturbation.original_text: Donated amounts will be allocated and dispersed to the Northern California Chapter beginning on the first full quarter [three (3) month period] of the Agreement and continue on a quarterly basis thereafter for the term of this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: Donated amounts will be allocated and dispersed to the Northern California Chapter beginning 18 months after the start of the Agreement, and continue on an annual basis thereafter for the term of this Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: This change extends the initial disbursement period to 18 months and alters the frequency to annually. Many states, including California, require charitable donations raised in connection with commercial ventures to be disbursed more frequently and in a timely manner. Delaying the initial disbursement and changing the frequency may violate regulations related to timely charitable donations, which could lead to legal issues.
perturbation.contradicted_law: California law regarding charitable solicitations (specifically, regulations pertaining to timely disbursement of funds raised for charitable purposes).

perturbation.original_text: The Company will provide to the NFLA-NC upon request the most recent quarterly sales report of the Company’s Licensed Products.
perturbation.changed_text: The Company will provide the NFLA-NC sales reports at the Company's sole discretion.
perturbation.explanation: This change removes the requirement for the company to provide quarterly sales reports upon request. This creates a conflict because by California law, businesses are required to maintain accurate records and, when dealing with charitable contributions based on sales, provide reasonable access to information supporting those contributions. Removing the guaranteed access to sales reports hinders transparency and potentially violates requirements for accountability in charitable fundraising.
perturbation.contradicted_law: California law related to accounting practices and transparency in charitable fundraising.

perturbation.original_text:
Parties agree to the addition of Gridiron CBD H2O Probiotic™ Water to “Licensed Products” as follows:

SECTION ONE. DEFINITIONS


As used in this Agreement, the following terms shall be defined as follows:




F.
“Licensed Products” shall mean BlackMP Living Water, BlackMP Concentrate, Zezel Probiotic Water, Zayin Sports
Water, Gridiron CBD H2O Probiotics™ Water, Gridiron MVP™ and Gridiron MVP™ Concentrate using the Pro
Football Legends Logo on the Licensed Products’ affixed labels, hang-tags or packaging. Other products of the
Company may be added to the list of Licensed Products during the Contract Period by written amendment to this
Agreement. All amendments to this Agreement must be signed by all parties to this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text:
Parties agree to the addition of Gridiron CBD H2O Probiotic™ Water to “Licensed Products” as follows:

SECTION ONE. DEFINITIONS


As used in this Agreement, the following terms shall be defined as follows:




F.
“Licensed Products” shall mean BlackMP Living Water, BlackMP Concentrate, Zezel Probiotic Water, Zayin Sports
Water, Gridiron CBD H2O Probiotics™ Water, Gridiron MVP™ and Gridiron MVP™ Concentrate using the Pro
Football Legends Logo on the Licensed Products’ affixed labels, hang-tags or packaging. The Company may unilaterally add or remove other products to/from the list of Licensed Products during the Contract Period without any amendment to this Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: This change allows the company to unilaterally modify the list of 'Licensed Products'. This contradicts general contract law principles requiring mutual consent for modifications. By permitting the company to unilaterally add or remove products from the license, the contract introduces ambiguity and potential for disputes. This can lead to legal challenge based on lack of mutual agreement.
perturbation.contradicted_law: General contract law principles regarding mutual consent and contract modification requirements. Potentially breaches of good faith and fair dealing.
